page.title: 17Transport in Northill
page.content: {Cars}are used by many residents as the {bus service}run by United Counties is limited. Pensioners hold subsidised bus passes. Some firms pick up workers from the village by coach, and{school {buses}run daily. Voluntary transport is organised for hospital visiting. As Northill village is between the A 1 and Bedford,{commercial vehicles}form much of the daytime traffic. Most evenings, vegetables for sale at market are collected by lorry. Speeds through the village tend to be excessive despite the 30 m.p.h. limit. {Horse riding}and{cycling}are popular, and ponies in traps are often driven. {Airliners}&{helicopters}pass overhead daily, also{micro-lights}and other small planes from nearby Shuttleworth Aerodrome. {Airships}from Cardington, and{hot-air balloons}in brilliant colours are frequently seen.
